item.title: Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at - The Times of India
item.description:
Morne Morkel reveals one area where Indian bowlers need to get better at

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Morne Morkel, India’s bowling coach, emphasized the need for improvement among Indian bowlers, particularly during the overs 50 to 80 against Australian batter Travis Head.

  • Morkel noted that the Indian bowlers struggled to execute their strategies effectively.
  • He highlighted the impact of the partnership between Travis Head and Steve Smith, which scored 171 runs in 31 overs.
  • Morkel indicated the need to improve execution during crucial phases of the match with a softer ball.
  • He defended the performance of other bowlers like Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep, commending their efforts despite challenges.
  • Morkel backed Ravindra Jadeja, emphasizing his status as a world-class player despite a tough outing.
“First of all, we can say he's (Head) in pretty good form... but I think for us with the ball... that's one area I think we need to get better at.” - Morne Morkel

The Indian bowling team is looking to enhance their game strategy to perform better in upcoming sessions, aiming to contain the scoring rate efficiently.

item.title: "Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Bowled Really Nicely": Steve Smith's Big Praise For Star India Pacer. It's Not Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a commendable performance during the third Test match, Indian pacer Akash Deep caught the attention of Australia’s Steve Smith, who noted Deep's remarkable bowling skills despite not taking any wickets.

  • Akash Deep received high praise from Steve Smith for his impressive bowling on the second day of the third Test.
  • Smith scored his 33rd Test hundred, contributing to Australia's strong position with 405 for seven at stumps, while facing tough spells from Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep.
  • Smith described Deep's first spell as having significant movement and excellent length, showcasing his skills as a bowler.
  • Travis Head also made a notable contribution with 152 runs from 160 balls, impressing both Smith and spectators.
  • Smith referenced past performance struggles against India, calling the series opener in Perth an anomaly.
"I thought Akash bowled really nicely. He has got some skill there for sure." - Steve Smith

This match highlights both the skill of Akash Deep and the competitive nature of the ongoing series, providing an exciting display of cricket.

item.title: "Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Get Out Of My Space": Australia Great Slams Mohammed Siraj-Marnus Labuschagne Bail-Switching Drama

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

One of the highlights of Day 2 of the third Test between India and Australia was the 'bail-switching' moment between Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj and Australian batter Marnus Labuschagne. Siraj's superstition led him to switch the bails, only for Labuschagne to switch them back before being dismissed shortly after.

  • The incident occurred during a crucial moment in the match.
  • Labuschagne was dismissed for 12 runs and criticized by Matthew Hayden for being distracted.
  • Travis Head, who replaced Labuschagne, scored a century and formed a strong partnership with Steve Smith.
  • Head now has over 1,200 runs against India in international cricket since 2023.
"He saw 55 deliveries, and had no go forward whatsoever. Even that little exchange, if it was me at the crease and a bowler does that. I am not caring less." - Matthew Hayden

Labuschagne's dismissal was a turning point, paving the way for a strong performance from Travis Head and Steve Smith, putting Australia in a dominant position.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Highlights: Travis Head, Steve Smith give Australia full control despite Bumrah fifer - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 2 Highlights

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Travis Head and Steve Smith's centuries gave Australia full control despite Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul on Day 2 of the ongoing Test at The Gabba.

  • Australia ended Day 2 at 405/7, having successfully crossed the 400-run mark.
  • Travis Head scored 152 runs, marking his ninth Test century, while Steve Smith made 101, ending his century drought.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was the standout bowler for India with a five-wicket haul, bringing his series total to 17 wickets.
  • Official attendance for Day 2 was reported at 34,227, indicating strong interest in the match.
  • Australia gained a significant advantage in the series, now level at 1-1 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Bumrah has been fighting a lone battle when it comes to Gabba.”

With rain predicted over the coming days, Australia appears poised to take control of the series unless India can respond strongly with the bat in the upcoming days.

item.title: Why X users are congratulating Nirmala Sitharaman over world chess champion D Gukesh's win - ThePrint
item.description:
Why X users are congratulating Nirmala Sitharaman over world chess champion D Gukesh's win

Date: December 13, 2024 Source: The Print

The nation is celebrating D. Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion at 18, with a humorous take on the income tax implications of his winnings, directing flattery towards Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and the tax department.

  • D. Gukesh became the youngest World Chess Champion, beating Ding Liren.
  • Social media users congratulated the income tax department for its expected share of Gukesh's earnings.
  • Gukesh's earnings from the championship total approximately $1.35 million, with significant tax liabilities.
  • Memes and jokes highlight the irony of the tax department winning without playing the game.
The Indian Tax Department is always a step ahead, making sure they get their share of the winnings!
— Sarvesh Yadav
Income Tax Department actually won the game without even playing 🤣
— Gokulnath

This chess victory has elicited lighthearted commentary about the intersection of success and taxation in India.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah targeted with racially-sensitive comment on air as Isa Guha sparks 'Monkeygate' fear

Date: Dec 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Former England cricketer Isa Guha has faced backlash after making a racially insensitive comment about Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah during a live commentary of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. The incident recalls the infamous 'Monkeygate' controversy of 2008.

  • Guha referred to Bumrah as a “primate” during her commentary.
  • The comment sparked outrage on social media, recalling the 2008 incident involving Harbhajan Singh.
  • Bumrah has been a standout performer in the series, achieving his 12th five-wicket haul on the same day.
  • The term used by Guha raised historical sensitivities among fans, particularly linked to past racial slurs in cricket.
  • Brett Lee praised Bumrah's performance prior to Guha's comment.
“He’s the MVP, isn’t he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah.” - Isa Guha

The criticism aimed at Guha emphasizes the importance of language in commentary and the sensitivity surrounding racial issues in sports.

item.title: India vs Australia: When Daniel Vettori bowled to Sarfaraz Khan in the nets - The Times of India
item.description:
India vs Australia: Daniel Vettori's Bowling Session with Sarfaraz Khan

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

During the lunch interval of the third Test, Indian players practiced in the nets while discussions about the game buzzed around them. Australian coach Daniel Vettori engaged with Sarfaraz Khan, helping him improve his skills.

  • On Day 2 of the third Test in Brisbane, while the crowd enjoyed lunch, Indian players were practicing in the nets.
  • Daniel Vettori, the Australian coach, bowled to Sarfaraz Khan, who was refining his batting techniques.
  • Despite rain limiting play on the first day, a sold-out crowd attended on Day 2, contributing to a lively atmosphere in the stadium.
“There was equal support for both sides from the stands and the constant boos, oohs, aahs and cheers contributed towards an excellent atmosphere in the stadium.”

The article highlights the engaging practice session and the positive atmosphere among players and the crowd, reflecting the spirit of the ongoing Test series.

item.title: 'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba - The Times of India
item.description:
'Resign immediately': Rohit Sharma under fire as Australia dominate India at The Gabba

Publication Date: New Delhi

India's cricket captain, Rohit Sharma, has faced severe backlash for his decisions during the third Test against Australia at The Gabba as the team struggles on the field.

  • India won the toss and chose to field, a decision met with criticism.
  • Australia scored 297/3 after 80 overs, raising questions about India’s tactical choices.
  • Fans have expressed frustration on social media, calling for Rohit’s resignation.
  • Rohit’s leadership is under scrutiny as India appears to be at a disadvantage.
“He's just not meant for this job, he needs to accept it and resign immediately after this Test irrespective of the outcome of this match.”

The pressure on Rohit continues to build as calls for change in leadership grow louder among fans and commentators.

item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 1, SCO vs STA Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between SCO vs STA?

The latest edition of the Big Bash League is all set to kick off with the Perth Scorchers facing the Melbourne Stars. Both teams aim to start the season on a winning note following contrasting performances in the previous edition.

  • Pitch Report: Favors bowlers, especially fast bowlers. Winning toss team likely to bowl first.

Notable Quotes:

“Perth Scorchers are predicted to win the match.”

It is anticipated that key players like Aaron Hardie and Jason Behrendorff will have significant contributions in the match.

Conclusion:

The match promises to be an exciting opener for the BBL 2024-25 season with Perth Scorchers as favorites going into the contest.

item.title: Virat Kohli's Celebration After Taking Marnus Labuschagne's Catch Goes Viral: Watch - News18
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Viral Celebration After Catching Marnus Labuschagne

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Marnus Labuschagne was dismissed by Virat Kohli in a thrilling moment during the India-Australia Test match at The Gabba in Brisbane, where Kohli’s energetic celebration after the catch quickly went viral.

  • Kohli caught Labuschagne off the bowling of Nitish Kumar Reddy, marking the third wicket for India.
  • Labuschagne was batting on 12 runs from 54 balls when he edged the ball to Kohli.
  • Kohli's finger-on-the-lip gesture during the celebration aimed at Aussie fans created a buzz online.
  • Earlier in the day, Kohli also caught Nathan McSweeney off Jasprit Bumrah's bowling.
  • India successfully took three Australian wickets with Bumrah picking up 2 for 26 in 14 overs.
Kohli celebrated aggressively after the catch, which went viral on the internet.

This moment exemplifies not only the intensity of the match but also Kohli's spirited demeanor on-field, showcasing his leadership and passion for the game.

item.title: Bucks dispatch Hawks, advance to NBA Cup title game - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bucks Defeat Hawks to Reach NBA Cup Final

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Milwaukee Bucks secured their place in the NBA Cup final after a 110-102 victory over the Atlanta Hawks, led by Giannis Antetokounmpo's impressive performance.

  • Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 30 points, 12 rebounds, and 8 assists.
  • Damian Lillard contributed 25 points, including pivotal shots in the second half.
  • Trae Young led the Hawks with 35 points and 10 assists.
  • The Bucks outscored the Hawks 28-19 in a defensive fourth quarter.
  • Milwaukee will face either the Oklahoma Thunder or Houston Rockets in the title game.
“The Bucks outscored the Hawks 28-19 in a highly defensive fourth quarter to secure their trip to the final.”

The Bucks demonstrated resilience by overcoming a third-quarter deficit and now look forward to their championship matchup.

item.title: India Release 3 Players From Border-Gavaskar Trophy Squad: Report - News18
item.description:
India Release 3 Players From Border-Gavaskar Trophy Squad: Report

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian cricket team has released three travelling reserves—Mukesh Kumar, Yash Dayal, and Navdeep Saini—from the Border-Gavaskar Trophy squad. They will participate in the upcoming 2024-25 Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • The players were released to gain match experience before the remaining two Tests of the series.
  • The Vijay Hazare Trophy starts on December 21 and features matches across 18 venues.
  • Mukesh, Yash, and Navdeep are returning to play for their respective domestic teams.
  • India’s squad includes five fast bowlers for the series against Australia.
“The team management feels that it will be better for the three players to get some game time under their belt.”

The release of these players allows them to contribute to their domestic teams while ensuring they maintain form ahead of future international commitments.

item.title: Shahid Afridi's pension is more than pension of Vinod Kambli, Pakistan star earns Rs...., while Kambli gets only... - India.com
item.description:
Shahid Afridi's pension is more than pension of Vinod Kambli

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: India.com

In a stark contrast concerning post-retirement benefits, Shahid Afridi, the former captain of Pakistan, receives a significantly higher pension compared to Vinod Kambli of India. This discrepancy highlights the varying levels of support provided by the cricket boards to their retired players.

  • Shahid Afridi earns a monthly pension of Rs 47,000.
  • On the other hand, Vinod Kambli receives only Rs 30,000 monthly.
  • The Pakistani cricket board categorizes retired players based on their match experience to determine pension amounts.
  • Players with 10 or fewer Test matches earn approximately Rs 43,000, while those with 21 or more can earn around Rs 47,000.
“This stark discrepancy brings to light the contrasting approaches of cricket boards toward their retired sportsmen.”

The differences in pension schemes raise questions about how sports bodies value their former athletes and the financial security provided to them after their careers end.

item.title: India's coach falls over after getting struck on the head during 3rd Australia Gabba Test, players rush to check on him - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India's Assistant Coach Injured During Warm-Up at Gabba Test

Date: Dec 15, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

India's assistant coach, Nuwan Seneviratne, was struck on the head during a warm-up session, causing players to rush to his aid.

  • Dramatic incident occurred on Day 2 of the third Test match at the Gabba.
  • Seneviratne was hit by a ball he didn't see coming and fell to the ground.
  • He was attended to by players and support staff before walking off the field with ice on his head.
  • Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah made early breakthroughs in the match, dismissing two Australian players.
“It’s a great length, indecisive, doesn’t know whether to play forward or backso gets struck on the crease.” - Aaron Finch

This incident raises concerns about player safety during warm-up routines, highlighting the need for vigilant practices in training sessions.

item.title: Player Ratings: Rayo Vallecano 3 - 3 Real Madrid; 2024 La Liga - Managing Madrid
item.description:
Player Ratings: Rayo Vallecano 3 - 3 Real Madrid; 2024 La Liga

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Full match player ratings below:

  • Thibaut Courtois: 5 - Felt positioning could have been better on the goals conceded.
  • Lucas Vazquez: 3 - Continues to struggle defensively, with poor communication.
  • Tchouameni: 5.5 - Strong in aerial duels but can take team out of shape.
  • Rudiger: 4 - Poor game; fell asleep on Rayo’s third goal.
  • Fran Garcia: 5 - Turned inside out on the opening goal.
  • Luka Modric: 5 - Some excellent passes but looked a step slow.
  • Fede Valverde: 7 - Scored a brilliant goal from outside the box.
  • Arda Guler: 7 - Recorded two assists and made crucial interceptions.
  • Jude Bellingham: 8.5 - Real Madrid’s best player with a seventh consecutive goal.
  • Brahim: 6 - Not enough involvement in the match.
  • Rodrygo: 8.5 - Assisted Bellingham and scored one himself.
  • Vinicius Junior: 6.5 - Misses the next match due to suspension.
  • Eduardo Camavinga: 6 - Showed lovely footwork on his return.
  • Dani Ceballos: N/A - Played the last 10 minutes.
  • Endrick: N/A - Late substitution with only 4 touches.

item.title: Virat Kohli teases Harbhajan Singh over his blazer, drops hook-step to Jitender's famous song; video goes viral - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Teases Harbhajan Singh Over His Blazer, Drops Hook-Step to Jitender's Famous Song; Video Goes Viral

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

During the rain-affected day of the third Test between India and Australia, a light-hearted moment unfolded between Virat Kohli and Harbhajan Singh, brightening the otherwise gloomy atmosphere.

  • The Test match was called off after just 13.2 overs due to rain.
  • Kohli was seen doing a dance that made Harbhajan burst into laughter.
  • Harbhajan recounted Kohli's playful banter, referencing actor Jitender's famous song.
  • Australia finished Day 1 at 28 without loss with Khawaja and McSweeney at the crease.
  • The match is set to resume on Day 2 with 98 overs to be bowled.
“Kohli looked at me and he was like ‘Jitender idhar aa gaya?’ and then he started singing ‘Naino Mein Sapna, Sapno Mein Sajna,’” - Harbhajan Singh

Virat Kohli aims for a comeback after mixed performances in the previous Tests.

item.title: Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story - The Indian Express
item.description:
Australia’s booing crowd should know Mohammed Siraj’s back story

Publication Date: 2024-12-10 Source: Indian Express

Mohammed Siraj faced challenges during the second Test at Adelaide, where he got his first wicket after a long and frustrating period of play.

  • Siraj finished with figures of 4/98 in 24.4 overs.
  • Despite his frustrating moments, he showcased pace, rhythm, and strategic planning.
  • Siraj’s charmingly amateurish style adds to his character on the field.
“Siraj would look exasperated, he would wipe the sweat on his face with his untucked shirt.”

This article emphasizes the importance of understanding the player's journey and struggles, rather than merely reacting to the crowd's behavior.

item.title: Jaffna Titans continue form, Hambantota Bangla Tigers pick crucial win in Lanka T10 Super League - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jaffna Titans Shine While Hambantota Bangla Tigers Secure Key Victory in Lanka T10 Super League

Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Lanka T10 Super League faced disruptions due to rain but saw thrilling action on Saturday as the Jaffna Titans and Hambantota Bangla Tigers recorded impressive victories.

  • Jaffna Titans defeated Galle Marvels by 7 wickets, chasing down a target of 106 with a dominant performance from openers Tom Kohler-Cadmore and Kusal Mendis.
  • Kohler-Cadmore scored 32 runs off 21 balls, while Mendis contributed 31 off 16 balls.
  • Hambantota Bangla Tigers won against Nuwara Eliya Kings by 7 wickets, successfully chasing a modest target of 83.
  • Kusal Perera was key for the Bangla Tigers, scoring 33 off 15 balls despite an early wicket.
  • The first match between Colombo Jaguars and Kandy Bolts was abandoned due to rain.
“This article was generated from an automated news agency feed without modifications to text.”

The matches showcased high levels of competition and skill, further elevating the excitement of the Lanka T10 Super League.
